Section 247A of the Municipal Councils Ordinance is as follows,

column2:
A  Municipal  Council  may 
impose  and 
levy  a  duty 
in
respect of licences issued by the Council.
The  duty  levied  under  subsection  (1)  in  respect  of  any
licence issued by the Council authorizing the use of any

premises 
for  any  of 
the  purposes  described 
in 
this
Ordinance  or  in  any  by-law  made  thereunder  shall  be
determined by the Council according to the annual value

of  the  premises  so 
licensed,  and,  where  such 
licence
authorizes  the  use  of  such  premises  for  the  purpose  of

(a) 
 the annual value of such premises;

(b)  
the turnover of business of such premises;

(c)  
the profit that is likely to be earned in such trade;
